internal.content:
--- title: "Check Installation" date: 2022-11-03T10:57:46+01:00 weight: 25 --- ## üöÄ TASK: Verify that the Operator is running and ready üåè Documentation for the Task: Online starter installation of CP4WAIOPS Check that the Operator is running and that you can continue with the next chapter to install CP4WAIOPS. You can do this by listing the `ClusterServiceVersions` (csv) for the `cp4waiops` Namespace. ## Check with the Command Line ```bash oc get csv -n cp4waiops ```
And you should see 7 entries with `Succeeded` state ```yaml NAME DISPLAY VERSION REPLACES PHASE ibm-aiops-orchestrator.v3.6.1 IBM Cloud Pak for Watson AIOps CP4WAIOPS 3.5.1 Succeeded ibm-automation-core.v1.3.11 IBM Automation Foundation Core 1.3.11 ibm-automation-core.v1.3.10 Succeeded ibm-automation-elastic.v1.3.10 IBM Elastic 1.3.10 ibm-automation-elastic.v1.3.9 Succeeded ibm-automation-eventprocessing.v1.3.11 IBM Automation Foundation Event Processing 1.3.11 ibm-automation-eventprocessing.v1.3.10 Succeeded ibm-automation-flink.v1.3.10 IBM Automation Foundation Flink 1.3.10 ibm-automation-flink.v1.3.9 Succeeded ibm-automation.v1.3.11 IBM Automation Foundation 1.3.11 ibm-automation.v1.3.10 Succeeded ibm-common-service-operator.v3.21.0 IBM Cloud Pak foundational services 3.21.0 Succeeded ```

## Check with your OpenShift Web Console 1. Go to Operators Installed Operators 1. You should get this: ![image](./../images/53_operators_installed.png) **You have successfully finished this Chapter** You are now done with the chapter on Installing the Operator. Please continue to the next chapter to learn how to install CP4WAIOPS.
